body: WHEN you hoist a leg over a barstool these days, you're as likely to find Tom Edison as a Tom Collins. Light bulbs have been popping up behind the bar, with more cocktails developed in the last 10 years than probably any decade since Prohibition. Some of them have emerged as modern classics, standing out not only as culinary creations, but also as
title: A Decade of Invention, and Reinvention

body: Arrayed throughout his office in Downtown Brooklyn are the touchstones of Salvatore Joseph Cassano's life -- keepsakes that speak of family, faith and the Fire Department he will lead come Jan. 1. A model of a military tank rests by a miniature of Ebbets Field, where the Brooklyn Dodgers used to play. An American flag pennant sits in a mug on his
title: A Fire Commissioner Devoted to Family and Dedicated to the Safety of His Corps

body: Sometimes all it takes is a little help if it is the right kind of help. title: THE NEEDIEST CASES; Back in the Driver's Seat, With a Small Boost

title: HABITATS; Post-Industrial Order

body: Fellow Americans: there's good news and bad regarding our national pastimes -- eating, snacking and pigging out. The Samurai Shopper respects our constitutional entitlement to life, liberty and the pursuit of voluptuously stacked hamburgers, but those entitlements weigh heavily on us. Literally. Carnivores run amok may soon be unable to run at all.
title: SAMURAI SHOPPER; Beef Encounters

body: ON a recent Sunday, at Clover Club, six young women giddily compared impressions of their mixed drinks. Nothing unusual in that. And at the next table a young
title: WINTER DRINKS ISSUE; The Final Frontier? It's an Eye-Opener

body: FOR a drink with a ball gag in its mouth, the Night Marcher has a lot to say about where cocktail culture may be heading. Some major themes in fashionable bars lately: small, elegant, stemmed glassware; arm garters; house-made bitters; a seriousness that is hard to distinguish from humorlessness; gin. title: WINTER DRINKS ISSUE; Staging A Rum Rebellion

body: Suzanne Tecza had spent a year redesigning the library at Middle School 126 in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, including colorful new furniture and elaborate murals of leafy trees. body: SELF EDGE is the name of a good-looking store on Orchard Street that opened in July. title: Passion for the Pint Overcomes Hurdles

body: The actress Jessica Hecht was full of mixed emotions as the curtain rose for one of the final Broadway performances of Neil Simon's ''Brighton Beach Memoirs'' this fall. title: Refugees From a Flop, Broadway Bound Again

title: ENTRY LEVEL; In Brooklyn, Her Farmer's Heart Is Happy

body: Oreo, a dog that was nursed back to health after surviving being thrown off the roof of a six-story building, was killed Friday by lethal injection. A 2-year-old pit bull, Oreo was euthanized in the New York City headquarters of the American Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals after the organization rebuffed last-minute pleas to spare
title: Despite Pleas to Spare Her Life, Oreo the Abused Pit Bull Is Euthanized

body: Oreo, a pit bull mix, was hailed as a miracle dog when she survived being hurled off a Brooklyn rooftop last summer. She had two broken legs and a broken rib. title: Oreo, Dog Who Survived Roof Fall, Will Be Euthanized

body: BIG cities like New York are both deeply convenient -- two steps to the deli for milk in the morning -- and deeply inconvenient. title: When Love Is a Schlep

body: Lose your job in Boston, Pittsburgh, Seattle or Trenton and you could collect $544 or more per week in unemployment benefits. title: New York's Newly Jobless Find $430 a Week in Benefits Doesn't Go Far

body: 8 P.M. (MTV) PEDRO (2008) Alex Loynaz stars in this drama based on the life of Pedro Zamora, right, who learned that he was H.I.V. positive when he was 17 and went on, in 1994, to star in ''The Real World: San Francisco'' and to raise AIDS awareness around the world. After his death from the disease at 22 in November 1994, one day after the final
title: What's On Today

body: Dell's Maraschino Cherries Company in Red Hook, Brooklyn, produces about a third of the country's maraschino cherries, according to the company's president, Arthur Mondella. Modernization and computerization enable the company to remain competitive, he said. Earlier pictures: nytimes.com/cityroom. LENS RICHARD PERRY
title: LENS RICHARD PERRY; Made in N.Y.C.

body: It took circus people, metalworkers, pirates and one very cold mermaid to raise a bar in Red Hook, Brooklyn, on Sunday. The event was the moving of the Tini Wine Bar -- formerly of 414 Van Brunt Street and indeed rather wee -- to a new space five blocks north on the same street, the waterfront neighborhood's main vein. Tini's owners, Monica Byrne
title: To Move a Wine Bar in Brooklyn, a Tiny Parade (Mermaid Included)

body: The old cobblestones on the Red Hook waterfront in Brooklyn have felt the weight of many kinds of vehicles, from wagons to tractor trailers to the snazzy cars and S.U.V.'s of the neighborhood's newer residents. But as a soft drizzle fell on Saturday night, the stones felt something new -- a clandestine bicycle race. From shortly after 11 p.m. until
title: A Brooklyn Bike Race Worthy of James Dean

body: IN the late evening hours of Aug. 19, 1999, 11-year-old Kelvin McGinnis was talking with friends in a courtyard at Saratoga Village, a public housing project in Bedford-Stuyvesant, Brooklyn. At 8:50 p.m., three young men rode by on bikes, carrying guns. They were gang members, police said later, and when they spotted a rival gang member in the
title: DISPATCHES; On Violent Ground, a Touch of Beauty

body: JAZZ Full reviews of recent jazz concerts: nytimes.com/music. DAVE ALLEN TRIO (Thursday) Dave Allen is a guitarist with a coolly modernistic sensibility, as he demonstrates on his most recent album, ''Real and Imagined'' (Fresh Sound New Talent). His current trio includes Massimo Biolcati on bass and Jochen Rueckert on drums. At 9 and 10:30 p.m.,
title: The Listings

body: Museums and Sites AMERICAN MUSEUM OF NATURAL HISTORY Sunday at 1 p.m., ''Spring Equinox,'' a performance by the Kodo drummers of Sado Island, Japan. Through Aug. 16, ''Climate Change: The Threat to Life and a New Energy Future,'' an interactive display. Through May 25, ''The Butterfly Conservatory: Tropical Butterflies Alive in Winter.'' In the
title: Spare Times

body: More than 25 years ago, Mohammed Abuzaid left his home in a farming region in southwestern Yemen and traveled to the United States for a new life. He struggled for years, working at a small grocery in Red Hook to bring his wife and five of his children over to join him in Brooklyn. After 18 years, he was able to start his own deli in Crown Heights.
title: Immigrant Died Protecting His New Life in Brooklyn

body: NANCY AND AZIZ LAMAZOU hail from Lebanon and Tunisia. During Mr. Lamazou's years as a diplomat, they ate their way across the globe. They're purveyors of fine European packaged goods. They cave continental cheeses beneath a New York City sidewalk. They sell carefully made sandwiches. Nicky Defonte, born and raised in Bay Ridge, Brooklyn, is the
title: $25 AND UNDER; Within Six Blocks, Worlds Apart

body: RESIDENTS of Red Hook, Brooklyn, who worry about car exhaust have long looked in consternation to the east, to the Brooklyn-Queens Expressway, or, more recently, to the south, where an Ikea store opened last year amid fears about the traffic it would draw. But when Adam Armstrong of Pioneer Street thinks of exhaust, he thinks of the westward view
title: DISPATCHES; Smoke on the Water

author: Mark Levine teaches at the Iowa Writers' Workshop.
body: MY NEIGHBOR JOE EMBRACED THE ZEITGEIST, or was embraced by it, shortly before Thanksgiving a couple of years ago when he decided to bid adieu to his S.U.V., a two-and-a-half ton specimen that was a pain to park, got only slightly better mileage than a cement mixer and bore a brand name that meant to evoke, through misspelling, a famously resilient
title: Share My Ride

body: TO get the slightly battered convection oven for their new Brooklyn chocolate factory, Rick and Michael Mast traded 250 chocolate bars. The chocolate is as good as legal tender for Andrew Tarlow and Mark Firth, owners of Marlow & Sons, the restaurant and specialty shop that bartered away the oven. ''We can't keep it in stock,'' Mr. Tarlow said.
title: Now in Brooklyn, the 19th Century

body: THERE is a script by which a restaurant can establish the food-world equivalent of street cred these days, and Buttermilk Channel follows almost every line of it. House-made pickles? They're here, advertised -- fashionably -- in a box in the upper-left-hand corner of the dinner menu, under the heading ''snacks.'' That's also where you'll find the
title: RESTAURANTS; Bringing Home the Bacon

body: FOR a guy who works with beer, Jeff Gorlechen was having a hard time getting his hands around one on Tuesday night. Mr. Gorlechen, 39, handles promotion for Sixpoint Craft Ales, a small brewer in Red Hook, Brooklyn, and he was at Sixpoint's fourth-anniversary party at Barcade, in Williamsburg, where the crowd at the bar was three deep. Mr.
title: DISPATCHES; Crying in Their Presidential Beer

body: For about 16 months, until December 2007, Tony Scherr's trio played every week at Marion's, on the Bowery. With the bassist Rob Jost and the drummer Anton Fier -- and whichever of his friends happened to wander through the club that night -- Mr. Scherr typically played guitar and sang for more than two hours, a thorough performance with no cover.
title: MUSIC REVIEW | TONY SCHERR; Friends Who Went Away Are Back, in a New Place

body: Open Now ABSINTHE WINE BAR Small plates that are billed as French tapas are featured at this East Village spot: 111 First Avenue (Sixth Street), (212) 777-0440. DOC'S This is the latest from Carl Redding, a founder of Amy Ruth's in Harlem, which he sold. It specializes in ribs and soul food: 1902 Adam Clayton Powell Boulevard (115th Street), (212)
title: Off the Menu

body: GREEN--Sidney W. One of the country's top fund raisers and a publicist for progressive causes died Saturday February 7th in Brooklyn, New York just 4 days after his 76th birthday. He succumbed to the complications of Alzheimer's disease. Born in Brooklyn, he was the son of Nathan Green and Helen Honig. The family owned a popular neighborhood candy
title: Paid Notice: Deaths GREEN, SIDNEY W

body: 9 P.M. (Starz) THE VISITOR (2008) In the role that has earned him an Oscar nomination for best actor, Richard Jenkins (above left, with Haaz Sleiman) plays a widowed, depressed professor of economics at Connecticut College who finds that his Manhattan apartment has been illegally rented to a drummer from Syria (Mr. Sleiman) and his Senegalese
title: WHAT'S ON TODAY

body: In ''The Caller,'' a corporate crime drama that runs fatally amok, Frank Langella plays Jimmy Stevens, a world-weary senior executive and numbers cruncher who blows the whistle on his company's fiscal corruption and then waits for the lethal consequences. The EN Corporation, the evil energy enterprise for which he works, has conducted dirty
title: MOVIE REVIEW | 'THE CALLER'; Awaiting Payback For Blowing The Whistle

body: The M/V North River, a twin-screw tanker out of Brooklyn, steamed past Rikers Island, swung to port, then slipped into its mooring in Hunts Point, in the Bronx. A deckhand tied the ship off while another hooked its hoses to a manifold. Above decks, in the bridge, the first mate took the signal, then gently depressed a switch. With a hum of quiet
title: ROOMS; Where the Sea Air Meets Its Match

body: One of the city's largest beer distributors has reached a tentative agreement to move to two piers on the waterfront in Red Hook, Brooklyn, where the distributor, stevedores and government officials hope to revive and expand once-bustling cargo operations. Phoenix Beverages, which distributes Heineken, Guinness, Brooklyn Beer, Smirnoff Ice and
title: Beer Distributor Makes a Deal to Move to Two Piers in Red Hook

body: International Role of U.N. Peacekeeper Raises Concerns Among Experts More than a decade after United Nations peacekeepers failed to prevent massacres in Rwanda and Srebrenica, Bosnia, diplomats and experts say that the organization's flagship mission appears to be slouching toward crisis once again because of a significant rise in the number of
title: INSIDE THE TIMES: February 11, 2009

body: AROUND TOWN Museums and Sites 3681 AMERICAN MUSEUM OF NATURAL HISTORY Saturday at 7:30 and 8:30 p.m., ''SonicVision,'' an animated alternative-music show, will be presented in the Rose Center for Earth and Space; tickets, $15; $12 for members. Through Aug. 16, ''Climate Change: The Threat to Life and a New Energy Future,'' an interactive display.
title: SPARE TIMES

body: IN the summer of 2006, a native New Yorker named Fran Moss went to Brooklyn to meet a firefighter friend at his firehouse in Red Hook. ''I'm a Manhattan girl,'' said Ms. Moss, a 50-something former dancer who grew up on the Upper West Side and is now semiretired to Westhampton. ''I didn't know where Red Hook was.'' As she waited outside the
title: URBAN STUDIES; A More Inviting Place To Await the Next Fire

body: MY closet is stuffed with shirts waiting to come back in style. Many are secondhand button-downs in plaids and buffalo prints from my early-'90s grunge years and, farther back in time, from the six months in 1985 when I tried really hard to look ''cowpunk.'' Like many thrift store finds, these shirts all have full, squarish cuts. I just don't feel
title: CRITICAL SHOPPER | SMITH & BUTLER; For Shapeshifters, Bringing Boxy Back

body: ''WHEN I roll back the tape of our marriage, I think I was ill-prepared,'' said Alan Harding, whose wife, Leslie Parks, and he are separated pending their divorce. ''I had to wear so many hats. I had to be the daddy. I had to bring home money. I had to be the husband and I had to be the best friend. I wasn't ready for that.'' Mr. Harding and Ms.
title: STATE OF THE UNIONS; Leslie Parks and Alan Harding

body: Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg, in a dramatic presentation Thursday that included a Ric Burns-narrated video and a marching band, invoked Franklin D. Roosevelt and the Sept. 11 attacks as he called for New Yorkers to endure the current economic crisis and ''come out stronger together.'' In his annual State of the City address, Mr. Bloomberg described
title: With Nod to History, Mayor Says City Will Recover

body: The colorful, abstract patterns of Amy Helfand's rugs are usually derived from nature. But for her latest collection, Ms. Helfand, an artist and designer in Red Hook, Brooklyn, took her inspiration from the ''prayer flags at Buddhist temples and hanging from trees'' that she photographed during a recent trip to Nepal, where her rugs are
title: CURRENTS | DéCOR; And No Need to Climb the Himalayas

body: In the 17 years ''The Real World'' has been appearing on MTV, it has deployed the services of 400 editors to scan 40,000 hours of film. As Jon Murray, one of the executive producers, explains in ''The Real World: Secrets Revealed,'' a special being shown this week anticipating the new season's start on Wednesday, this progenitor of reality
title: TELEVISION REVIEW | 'THE REAL WORLD'; The Show That Put the 'Real' in Reality TV

body: Television Mike Hale ''The Real World,'' for many people, holds an awful fascination: it's a show you love to hate. Brooklyn, especially in its blog-happy western precincts, can be an especially judgmental place: it's the borough that hates to love. Irresistible force meets immovable object this week with the premiere of ''THE REAL WORLD:
title: THE WEEK AHEAD | JAN. 4 - JAN. 10 | Television

author: Ed Morales is director and producer, with his partner, Laura Rivera, of ''Whose Barrio?,'' a documentary film about the gentrification of East Harlem.
body: ABOUT two years ago, an episode occurred on the brownstone block of Sixth Avenue, right smack in the middle of Park Slope, where I had lived for three years with my girlfriend, Laura, that would be a portent of our impending doom. A 40-something woman whose house was two doors down occasionally got very drunk and threw tantrums in her front doorway
title: Apartment Lost, Home Found
